solution_line_template: The discount for each gallon of whole milk is ${milk_normal_price} - ${milk_discounted_price} = $<<{milk_normal_price}-{milk_discounted_price}={milk_discount_per_gallon}>>{milk_discount_per_gallon}.

So the discount for {num_gallons} gallons of whole milk is ${milk_discount_per_gallon}/gallon x {num_gallons} gallons = $<<{milk_discount_per_gallon}*{num_gallons}={milk_total_discount}>>{milk_total_discount}.
The total discount for {num_boxes} boxes of cereal is ${cereal_discount_per_box}/box x {num_boxes} boxes = $<<{cereal_discount_per_box}*{num_boxes}={cereal_total_discount}>>{cereal_total_discount}.
You will save ${milk_total_discount} + ${cereal_total_discount} = $<<{milk_total_discount}+{cereal_total_discount}={total_savings}>>{total_savings} for 3 gallons of whole milk and 5 boxes of cereal.
